subject: Technology
title: SixDegrees: The First Social Network
description: Learn SixDegrees: The First Social Network in one minute.

hook.text: Before Facebook, before MySpace, there was SixDegrees. It launched in 1997 and nobody cared.

buildup.text: SixDegrees let users create profiles, list friends, and browse friend lists. It was the blueprint for every social network.

discovery.text: It reached 3.5 million users but couldn't make money. There wasn't enough internet content to keep people engaged.

twist.text: SixDegrees was sold for $125 million, then shut down in 2001. The idea was right. The timing was too early.

climax.text: Every social network since has used the same core features SixDegrees invented: profiles, connections, and feeds.

punchline.text: The first social network had every right idea. The world just wasn't ready.

quiz.question: Why did SixDegrees fail despite inventing the social network model?
options: It launched too early when the internet lacked enough content and users
It was banned by the government
